intro: Ficus subfulva var. subfulva, commonly known as the variegated rubber plant, is a species of flowering plant in the family Moraceae. It is native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia, including parts of India and Malaysia. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves with creamy-white to yellow variegation patterns. It is a popular indoor plant due to its adaptability and air-purifying qualities. Ficus subfulva var. subfulva typically grows as an evergreen shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 meters in its natural habitat.
